title: Episode 239: Incompatible behaviour & positive punishment
summary:
Incompatible behaviour & positive punishment is a topic from a quote that we posted on our instagram some months back.  The quote was from Dr. Susan Friedman and it says.



"The key question is not, how do I stop this problem behaviour? Rather, the question is, what do I want the animal to do instead, then teach it."



It's a good quote with plenty of merit.  There are many who have taken it and have inferred that in order to do this justice, it can only be by way of teaching incompatible behaviours so the dog cannot perform the old behaviour.



We feel that incompatible behaviour is certainly a consideration, however it's limiting by not addressing punishment.



In this episode we discussed the ramifications of just this.



Further details



looking for great dog trainers and supporters of the canine paradigm? Below is a vast array of people and business’s who stand by us, donate to our running costs and do great things for the canine community.



Glenn runs and has almost everything canine related at, Canine Evolution or Pet Resorts Australia



Pat has a full range of coaching and dog training services at Operant Canine



You can support our show and get extra content right here on our Patreon page. Everything goes into keeping the show running and we love all the wonderful people who are part of that community. If you’re not sure how, just ask us.



You can get our full range of our Merch at our Teespring store here



You can help us by spreading the word amongst the canine community or even suggesting a special guest to interview.



If you need to find out how to listen to our podcast, go here



We have a YOUTUBE channel that you can subscribe to now



If you enjoyed the podcast, please review us on Itunes, spotify and any other podcast directory



Details on joining the IACP can be found here. If you’re not in it you should be! Truth!



Check out Dogs Playing for Life! A rescue process changing dogs lives across the USA



For more details on how to help our friends at Peggy’s Promise, you can find all the details on how to do that on their website. They are our rescue charity of choice.



Support our supporters



Narelle Cooke’s raw feeding guide for dogs here.

title: Episode 238: Lessons from the tantrum
summary:
Lessons from the tantrum came from an actual full scale, first off tantrum that Pat's second son Axel had.  According to Pat, it was of epic proportions and it gave him some perspective on how his dog must feel when he is confused about a situation and doesn't have the ability to effectively communicate it.



Any good educator will always consider the teachable moment, even in an unfavourable moment.  Even a child's tantrum, which most parents would prefer to not have to go through can be an insight into language, behaviour or control.



For us, it was a way of taking a child tantrum and swinging back into a relative topic about training dogs.



perhaps this a good line for an episode from the past talking about how to deal with pressure

You can help us by spreading the word amongst the canine community or even suggesting a special guest to interview.

If you enjoyed the podcast, please review us on Itunes, spotify and any other podcast directory

title: Episode 237: Cam Ford & the scent detection avengers
summary:
Cam Ford & the scent detection avengers is another great episode that we got to have in person with our great friend, Cameron Ford.



Although the wonderful team of  doctors and specialists that presented at the Australian K9 scent detection conference were not with us, we got to think about and discuss their wonderful work.



The scent detection world is so diverse and wonderfully eclectic that it deserves and demands peer review and high levels of study.  we were very fortunate to be involved in the conference and to have spent more time with Cameron so we could pick his brain.



We had the opportunity not long ago to speak with Cameron and Jerry Bradshaw on this episode



Further details



looking for great dog trainers and supporters of the canine paradigm? Below is a vast array of people and business’s who stand by us, donate to our running costs and do great things for the canine community.



Glenn runs and has almost everything canine related at, Canine Evolution or Pet Resorts Australia



Pat has a full range of coaching and dog training services at Operant Canine



You can support our show and get extra content right here on our Patreon page. Everything goes into keeping the show running and we love all the wonderful people who are part of that community. If you’re not sure how, just ask us.



You can get our full range of our Merch at our Teespring store here



You can help us by spreading the word amongst the canine community or even suggesting a special guest to interview.



If you need to find out how to listen to our podcast, go here



We have a YOUTUBE channel that you can subscribe to now



If you enjoyed the podcast, please review us on Itunes, spotify and any other podcast directory



Details on joining the IACP can be found here. If you’re not in it you should be! Truth!



Check out Dogs Playing for Life! A rescue process changing dogs lives across the USA



For more details on how to help our friends at Peggy’s Promise, you can find all the details on how to do that on their website. They are our rescue charity of choice.



Support our supporters



Narelle Cooke’s raw feeding guide for dogs here. Narelle has her own podcast on all podcast directories called

title: Episode 236: Jas Whiting raising working puppies
summary:
Jas Whiting raising working puppies is the long awaited update on what our great friend Jas has been up to.  Even though we see her regularly there's been a lot of time between pod-cast catchups. 



Also, Jas has been doing a bunch of amazing things. Kicking ass in the BJJ scene, lecturing at conferences, doing seminars, keeping up GRC training and more.



Safe to say that Jas has been doing some amazing things and keeping herself very busy in the dog world.



Here's an old episode we did about training and raising puppies




https://thecanineparadigm.com/2021/02/06/episode-165-working-dog-radio/




Further details



looking for great dog trainers and supporters of the canine paradigm? Below is a vast array of people and business’s who stand by us, donate to our running costs and do great things for the canine community.



Glenn runs and has almost everything canine related at, Canine Evolution or Pet Resorts Australia



Pat has a full range of coaching and dog training services at Operant Canine



You can support our show and get extra content right here on our Patreon page. Everything goes into keeping the show running and we love all the wonderful people who are part of that community. If you’re not sure how, just ask us.



You can get our full range of our Merch at our Teespring store here



You can help us by spreading the word amongst the canine community or even suggesting a special guest to interview.



If you need to find out how to listen to our podcast, go here



We have a YOUTUBE channel that you can subscribe to now



If you enjoyed the podcast, please review us on Itunes, spotify and any other podcast directory



Details on joining the IACP can be found here. If you’re not in it you should be! Truth!



Check out Dogs Playing for Life! A rescue process changing dogs lives across the USA



For more details on how to help our friends at Peggy’s Promise, you can find all the details on how to do that on their website. They are our rescue charity of choice.



Support our supporters



Narelle Cooke’s raw feeding guide for dogs here. Narelle has her own podcast on all podcast directories called

title: Episode 235: Marketing and the low hanging fruit
summary:
Marketing and the low hanging fruit is an inspired conversation from one of Larry Krohn's online posts.  Larry was exceptionally disappointed when a colleague came into the chat and made some confrontational comments.



This aside, it raised some interesting notation on social media marketers versus their actual ability as a trainer.  Multiples of conversations have been had on our platform and others about the effectiveness of marketing  and the clown show around it.



Marketing is essential for a business.  You have to do it to stay relevant.  Social media has just made it easy for the turds to rise from the drains.



Here a similar topic we did called arguing with an avatar



Further details



looking for great dog trainers and supporters of the canine paradigm? Below is a vast array of people and business’s who stand by us, donate to our running costs and do great things for the canine community.



Glenn runs and has almost everything canine related at, Canine Evolution or Pet Resorts Australia



Pat has a full range of coaching and dog training services at Operant Canine



You can support our show and get extra content right here on our Patreon page. Everything goes into keeping the show running and we love all the wonderful people who are part of that community. If you’re not sure how, just ask us.



You can get our full range of our Merch at our Teespring store here



You can help us by spreading the word amongst the canine community or even suggesting a special guest to interview.



If you need to find out how to listen to our podcast, go here



We have a YOUTUBE channel that you can subscribe to now



If you enjoyed the podcast, please review us on Itunes, spotify and any other podcast directory



Details on joining the IACP can be found here. If you’re not in it you should be! Truth!



Check out Dogs Playing for Life! A rescue process changing dogs lives across the USA



For more details on how to help our friends at Peggy’s Promise, you can find all the details on how to do that on their website. They are our rescue charity of choice.



Support our supporters



Narelle Cooke’s raw feeding guide for dogs here. Narelle has her own podcast on all podcast directories called

title: Episode 234: Without the cookies I’m just a monster
summary:
Without the cookies, I'm just a monster is a part of a bigger story that developed from a listeners question on our discussion forum.  It came about when we discussed how people can carry a burden for so long, that when given an option to lose it, they are scared of who they are without their cookies, or bad behaviors.



The majority of the story is talking about the potential of poisoning reinforcers, (food) when connecting desired behaviours to unforeseen aversive.  It's not about literally poisoning food as we're not that kind of monster either. That's it for the cookies and the monster references.



Check out our first interview we did with Tyler Muto who we plan to get back on board



Further details



looking for great dog trainers and supporters of the canine paradigm? Below is a vast array of people and business’s who stand by us, donate to our running costs and do great things for the canine community.



Glenn runs and has almost everything canine related at, Canine Evolution or Pet Resorts Australia



Pat has a full range of coaching and dog training services at Operant Canine



You can support our show and get extra content right here on our Patreon page. Everything goes into keeping the show running and we love all the wonderful people who are part of that community. If you’re not sure how, just ask us.



You can get our full range of our Merch at our Teespring store here



You can help us by spreading the word amongst the canine community or even suggesting a special guest to interview.



If you need to find out how to listen to our podcast, go here



We have a YOUTUBE channel that you can subscribe to now



If you enjoyed the podcast, please review us on Itunes, spotify and any other podcast directory



Details on joining the IACP can be found here. If you’re not in it you should be! Truth!



Check out Dogs Playing for Life! A rescue process changing dogs lives across the USA



For more details on how to help our friends at Peggy’s Promise, you can find all the details on how to do that on their website. They are our rescue charity of choice.



Support our supporters



Narelle Cooke’s raw feeding guide for dogs here. Narelle has her own podcast on all podcast directories called

title: Episode 233: The evils of cherry picking information
summary:
The evils of cherry picking information have been more evident in social media posts where agenda driven lunatics are trying to destroy a target.  Politicians are amongst the worst of the cherry pickers, especially around election times.  They are also amongst the least trusted people in the world.



Cherry pickers are trying to direct the attention of many people onto the focus of one or several people.  However, they may need to be the point of focus themselves as they can be hate filled, agenda driven, divisive nut cases with intentions of destruction over building community or developing culture.



It's reassuring to know that this is the small minority and not the wonderful, supportive majority of our canine community that we have come to know and love.



After you listen to this episode, there's plenty more like this one



Further details



looking for great dog trainers and supporters of the canine paradigm? Below is a vast array of people and business’s who stand by us, donate to our running costs and do great things for the canine community.



Glenn runs and has almost everything canine related at, Canine Evolution or Pet Resorts Australia



Pat has a full range of coaching and dog training services at Operant Canine



You can support our show and get extra content right here on our Patreon page. Everything goes into keeping the show running and we love all the wonderful people who are part of that community. If you’re not sure how, just ask us.



You can get our full range of our Merch at our Teespring store here



You can help us by spreading the word amongst the canine community or even suggesting a special guest to interview.



If you need to find out how to listen to our podcast, go here



We have a YOUTUBE channel that you can subscribe to now



If you enjoyed the podcast, please review us on Itunes, spotify and any other podcast directory



Details on joining the IACP can be found here. If you’re not in it you should be! Truth!



Check out Dogs Playing for Life! A rescue process changing dogs lives across the USA



For more details on how to help our friends at Peggy’s Promise, you can find all the details on how to do that on their website. They are our rescue charity of choice.



Support our supporters



Narelle Cooke’s raw feeding guide for dogs

title: Episode 231: The new puppy and the baby trainer
summary:
The new puppy and the baby trainer is an episode covering Birdy O'Sheedy's new puppy, PAX and how she is doing with him.  It's also about Pat's experience with a baby trainer when Axel was having sleeping problems.



Birdy is an experienced dog owner from having her time with Luna, however she has never raised a puppy before.  Now her and Dan are experience a different life with their new baby, Pax the Labrador so we get a run down of the antics that Skippy Mayhem is causing.



Meanwhile at the Stuart residence, Pat and Jane are breathing a sigh of relief after baby Axel has learned to not have baby party time in their bed.



check this link for other puppy related episodes we've done



Further details



looking for great dog trainers and supporters of the canine paradigm? Below is a vast array of people and business’s who stand by us, donate to our running costs and do great things for the canine community.



Glenn runs and has almost everything canine related at, Canine Evolution or Pet Resorts Australia



Pat has a full range of coaching and dog training services at Operant Canine



You can support our show and get extra content right here on our Patreon page. Everything goes into keeping the show running and we love all the wonderful people who are part of that community. If you’re not sure how, just ask us.



You can get our full range of our Merch at our Teespring store here



You can help us by spreading the word amongst the canine community or even suggesting a special guest to interview.



If you need to find out how to listen to our podcast, go here



We have a YOUTUBE channel that you can subscribe to now



If you enjoyed the podcast, please review us on Itunes, spotify and any other podcast directory



Details on joining the IACP can be found here. If you’re not in it you should be! Truth!



Check out Dogs Playing for Life! A rescue process changing dogs lives across the USA



For more details on how to help our friends at Peggy’s Promise, you can find all the details on how to do that on their website. They are our rescue charity of choice.



Support our supporters



Narelle Cooke’s raw feeding guide for dogs here. Narelle has her own podcast on all podcast directories called

title: Episode 230: Intuition versus learned from others
summary:
Intuition versus learned from others was being discussed in an on-line forum and there were some interesting back and forth comments which sparked good conversation.



So what's right? Do trainers have intuition from the beginning or do they always learn from a skilled mentor.  If we are talking about intuition, what does that even look like or feel like to those who have it?



How did your mentor learn when they got into the biz?  Did they have intuition or were they in turn mentored?



Check out some of the earlier episode we have done on similar topics, episode 161 and episode 117



Further details



looking for great dog trainers and supporters of the canine paradigm? Below is a vast array of people and business’s who stand by us, donate to our running costs and do great things for the canine community.



Glenn runs and has almost everything canine related at, Canine Evolution or Pet Resorts Australia



Pat has a full range of coaching and dog training services at Operant Canine



You can support our show and get extra content right here on our Patreon page. Everything goes into keeping the show running and we love all the wonderful people who are part of that community. If you’re not sure how, just ask us.



You can get our full range of our Merch at our Teespring store here



You can help us by spreading the word amongst the canine community or even suggesting a special guest to interview.



If you need to find out how to listen to our podcast, go here



We have a YOUTUBE channel that you can subscribe to now



If you enjoyed the podcast, please review us on Itunes, spotify and any other podcast directory



Details on joining the IACP can be found here. If you’re not in it you should be! Truth!



Check out Dogs Playing for Life! A rescue process changing dogs lives across the USA



For more details on how to help our friends at Peggy’s Promise, you can find all the details on how to do that on their website. They are our rescue charity of choice.



Support our supporters



Narelle Cooke’s raw feeding guide for dogs here. Narelle has her own podcast on all podcast direct...

And you see the problem immediately, you go here, look like this, and you can immediately bring up more from the dog and get more out of the dog.
You can achieve what they've been trying to achieve with the dog for a long time in a very short period of time.
I've certainly done that with people and then have people say, oh yeah, but like you're a natural at it or infer that intuition part.
That's like, nah, I've just done this before.
This is the first time that you've done this and the learning curve is steep and certainly it was exactly for me as well.
But I have done this plenty of times and I've got a good memory and I've I've experienced it.
And even I've watched other people with the same problem work through it.
And I put that in the Rolodex of things that I can work through.
So I think like from my point of view, I think that intuition in dog training is important for sure.
But I think as in most things, nothing trumps hard work.
I think that that's kind of the key to a lot of this kind of stuff is that like I think that you need to be saying dog training.
You could go from being terrible to really good.
And I think that you could go from being good to being exceptional.
I think that there isn't like so by that, I mean that there is an element that like a certain sort of like a je ne sais quoi.
Like you either have it or you don't.
But that's to get like to the very like the very top.
Because I just think that anybody who's willing to work really hard and put in the yards and learn and take on things and apply it and not just keep working at the same thing over and over.
But try new things, try new experiences, seek out new information, give new inputs to the dog.
I think that you can get really good just by doing that.
And I think that really in any industry or in anything does natural skill and intuition beat in the long run somebody who's just willing to put in the work.
You know, I think that that's the formula to success is fucking hard work.
That's a very good point because I don't know anybody that's been very successful in what they've done without being fucking hard workers.
You know, like there's a lot of people out there.
It just doesn't fall in their lap.
You know, they do a lot of work.
And there's not a lot of credit given to all the midnight all that they're burning thinking about this.

You know, like the time spent, the notepads that have been filled, the afternoons that have been contemplated, the skill sets that they've actually gone out with, the training that they've done, the consideration that's had to go into everything like this.
Just a myriad of things and processes and mindsets that have been changed and changed.
And it might have just been small increments, but it's enough that they've gone into some wild and some scary places.
But they've thought, you know, without thinking like this, how am I going to change the paradigms in which I'm currently fixed as a trainer into doing something that nobody's ever seen before?

Because if we're all, like I said, if we're all just focused on copying each other and there's, you know, there's a lot of exciting things that I've seen people doing where everybody wants to copy it.
I think you said it many years ago in one of their early podcasts we did.

You can see blueprints of who people have been training or mentoring under because you can see elements of what they're doing because they're copying people that they find motivation and enthusiasm in.
And that's great because those people are already doing good work and they're doing good things for their dog.
And they're showing people to have better foundations and better relationships with their dog.
So serious kudos.
But if you feel that you're ready to start moving into some of those other areas, you have to become exploratory.
In order to get to Mars, you have to first fucking work out how to build a ship that's going to get you there.
And when you're there, you're going to have to realize, how do I survive here until I get back home again?
You know, I mean, that's all dangerous thinking that people have got to come up and think with, you know, like they've got to they've got to have the strategy.
They can't just go to Mars and think, fuck, now I'm going to die here because I can't get home.
That's a kind of thinking we've got to avoid with our dogs is, you know, now I've got my dog to this point.
Where do I go from here?
Because I don't know what to do anymore because I haven't planned the next step.
You know, like I haven't thought out the strategy of how to return or how to communicate what the how the dog wins in this scenario.
And that's where you need to think about it.
And that's why I've said it's just this great big scavenger hunt that you really need to go on and it needs to be put on paper first.
And it's so much work in the background that people don't realize and don't appreciate that there's been, let's say, hundreds of hours thinking about it.
And then maybe, let's say, 20 hours of actually putting it into the dog training.
And you just think, oh, where'd that come from? That just came from nowhere.
Well, it's decades or years in the making of thinking about all these things critically to get you to a junction where you think now I can put it all together.

Because I do have the skill set and the capability to think outside the square of knowing all the foundations of learning behavior and how to implement it properly, that I can do things where I'm communicating with the dog on a whole new level.

That's transpired more so in the last, I think, in the last 15 to 20 years, especially, you know, like definitely in the last 15 years, where there's been a rise in mostly females have done in the dog training field where I'm watching them, which only world champions were doing, you know, like 20 plus years ago.
And now you're seeing people in their backyards doing it just for fun.
Like the healing that's around in backyard training now is equivalent to what was the world's best.
And those dogs would be on a podium in some of the most advanced training disciplines back then.
And now it's common, you know, like people all over the world are just trudging around the street, doing it to show people on their Instagram accounts.
There is a real trend in some serious fuckery going on with dogs, you know, but not bad stuff.
I'm talking good stuff.
This is really good stuff that's going into some really deep areas because people are thinking it became the norm.
But the exciting stuff is what's happening next.
You know, the new frontiers that people are now creating in training because they're already making that a standard sort of outcome for the dog.
It's great.
It's really exciting.
It's fun to watch.
It's, you know, watching that evolution, the evolution in training and seeing that happen.
We see a lot of trends recreating themselves and to steal a phrase that you were saying before is what is old is new again.
Even so, some of that old is new again mentality is to create some of these new frontiers as well.
Like they're bringing back things and then adding a new flair to it as well.

You know, so even though they brought back something old because of that, it transpired into something brand new, like a new foundation was created because something that was old was brought back, which wasn't being used to its full.
Potential.
But now it is like it's on the it's on the forefront of being used to its full potential.
That sort of shit is just wild.
Yeah.
I reckon that's time to wrap it up.
It's a good area.
Guys.
Yep.
It's a good area on a late night.

title: Episode 228: My partner is not a dog person
summary:
My partner is not a dog person, is almost blasphemy in the industry of dog trainers, yet it's not that abnormal.  For many of us, the other person in our lives is just not into the obsessive side of dogs. They don't get it



Of course we say that with compassion and understanding because it's something we have experience with.  In fact, so does the other person in our lives.



It's a tricky situation and different people deal with it in different ways.  We did an episode some time back about a similar but different topic where partners can create issues with the dog because the don't get it. The link is here https://thecanineparadigm.com/2021/12/27/episode-205-the-best-way-to-train-a-dog/



Further details



looking for great dog trainers and supporters of the canine paradigm? Below is a vast array of people and business’s who stand by us, donate to our running costs and do great things for the canine community.



Glenn runs and has almost everything canine related at, Canine Evolution or Pet Resorts Australia



Pat has a full range of coaching and dog training services at Operant Canine



You can support our show and get extra content right here on our Patreon page. Everything goes into keeping the show running and we love all the wonderful people who are part of that community. If you’re not sure how, just ask us.



You can get our full range of our Merch at our Teespring store here



You can help us by spreading the word amongst the canine community or even suggesting a special guest to interview.



If you need to find out how to listen to our podcast, go here



We have a YOUTUBE channel that you can subscribe to now



If you enjoyed the podcast, please review us on Itunes, spotify and any other podcast directory



Details on joining the IACP can be found here. If you’re not in it you should be! Truth!



Check out Dogs Playing for Life! A rescue process changing dogs lives across the USA



For more details on how to help our friends at Peggy’s Promise, you can find all the details on how to do that on their website. They are our rescue charity of choice.



Support our supporters



Narelle Cooke’s raw feeding guide for dogs here. Narelle has her own podcast on all podcast directories called

title: Episode 227: The most dangerous advice part 2
summary:
The most dangerous advice part 2 is naturally a follow on conversation from our last episode.



In this latest addition, Glenn reveals to Pat something from his past experience and some of the advice from a positive only group, that still to this day makes him think about what it cost some dogs.



Advice can still be questioned and sometime should be if it doesn't sit well.



Further details



looking for great dog trainers and supporters of the canine paradigm? Below is a vast array of people and business’s who stand by us, donate to our running costs and do great things for the canine community.



Glenn runs and has almost everything canine related at, Canine Evolution or Pet Resorts Australia



Pat has a full range of coaching and dog training services at Operant Canine



You can support our show and get extra content right here on our Patreon page. Everything goes into keeping the show running and we love all the wonderful people who are part of that community. If you’re not sure how, just ask us.



You can get our full range of our Merch at our Teespring store here



You can help us by spreading the word amongst the canine community or even suggesting a special guest to interview.



If you need to find out how to listen to our podcast, go here



We have a YOUTUBE channel that you can subscribe to now



If you enjoyed the podcast, please review us on Itunes, spotify and any other podcast directory



Details on joining the IACP can be found here. If you’re not in it you should be! Truth!



Check out Dogs Playing for Life! A rescue process changing dogs lives across the USA



For more details on how to help our friends at Peggy’s Promise, you can find all the details on how to do that on their website. They are our rescue charity of choice.



Support our supporters



Narelle Cooke’s raw feeding guide for dogs here. Narelle has her own podcast on all podcast directories called Natural Health for people and pets. Check it out.



Looking for the best, human grade supplement range for your dogs? Check out Canine Ceuticals SHOW SPONSOR



Jason Firmin

title: Episode 226: The most dangerous advice part 1
summary:
The most dangerous advice part 1 is focusing on something that really annoys Pat and he wants you all to know about it.



 You will get access to great advice in your lifetime, however, some can be very dangerous.



The danger happens because it's based on the bedrock of ignorance and it can get you or others hurt.  Even though it may be coming from a good place, it still doesn't mean it's not dangerous advice.



Further details



looking for great dog trainers and supporters of the canine paradigm? Below is a vast array of people and business’s who stand by us, donate to our running costs and do great things for the canine community.



Glenn runs and has almost everything canine related at, Canine Evolution or Pet Resorts Australia



Pat has a full range of coaching and dog training services at Operant Canine



If you wish to learn a little more stories where we may have been caught out, go here



You can support our show and get extra content right here on our Patreon page. Everything goes into keeping the show running and we love all the wonderful people who are part of that community. If you’re not sure how, just ask us.



You can get our full range of our Merch at our Teespring store here



You can help us by spreading the word amongst the canine community or even suggesting a special guest to interview.



If you need to find out how to listen to our podcast, go here



We have a YOUTUBE channel that you can subscribe to now



If you enjoyed the podcast, please review us on Itunes, spotify and any other podcast directory



Details on joining the IACP can be found here. If you’re not in it you should be! Truth!



Check out Dogs Playing for Life! A rescue process changing dogs lives across the USA



For more details on how to help our friends at Peggy’s Promise, you can find all the details on how to do that on their website. They are our rescue charity of choice.



Support our supporters



Narelle Cooke’s raw feeding guide for dogs here. Narelle has her own podcast on all podcast directories called Natural Health for people and pets. Check it out.



Looking for the best,

title: Episode 225: The narrow scope between -R and -P
summary:
The narrow scope between -R and -P was a fun conversation between both of us even though it's a largely and technically debated subject.



The reason we consider it a narrow scope is due to it being a splitting of hairs in how easy it can be to confuse where the dogs head is and assume one state over the other.



That narrow section in the middle is often where assumptions are made and sometime a wrong choice is being made.



Further details



looking for great dog trainers and supporters of the canine paradigm? Below is a vast array of people and business’s who stand by us, donate to our running costs and do great things for the canine community.



Glenn runs and has almost everything canine related at, Canine Evolution or Pet Resorts Australia



Pat has a full range of coaching and dog training services at Operant Canine



If you wish to learn a little more stories where we may have been caught out, go here



You can support our show and get extra content right here on our Patreon page. Everything goes into keeping the show running and we love all the wonderful people who are part of that community. If you’re not sure how, just ask us.



You can get our full range of our Merch at our Teespring store here



You can help us by spreading the word amongst the canine community or even suggesting a special guest to interview.



If you need to find out how to listen to our podcast, go here



We have a YOUTUBE channel that you can subscribe to now



If you enjoyed the podcast, please review us on Itunes, spotify and any other podcast directory



Details on joining the IACP can be found here. If you’re not in it you should be! Truth!



Check out Dogs Playing for Life! A rescue process changing dogs lives across the USA



For more details on how to help our friends at Peggy’s Promise, you can find all the details on how to do that on their website. They are our rescue charity of choice.



Support our supporters



Narelle Cooke’s raw feeding guide for dogs here. Narelle has her own podcast on all podcast directories called Natural Health for people and pets. Check it out.

title: Episode 224: Temperament testing puppies vs adult dogs
summary:
Temperament testing puppies vs adult dogs is a regular question many trainers are asked.  Especially if they are to be considered for working dogs in roles that will needs some planning.



The benefit of the adult dog is that you have the raw product in front of you.  Primarily, what you see is what you get.  with so many things to consider,  the adult dog will be a lot closer to what you want than a puppy is.



You still need to consider the temperament in pet homes and try and be as honest as possible with the client or the trainer for what the dog will be coming into.







Further details



looking for great dog trainers and supporters of the canine paradigm? Below is a vast array of people and business’s who stand by us, donate to our running costs and do great things for the canine community.



Glenn runs and has almost everything canine related at, Canine Evolution or Pet Resorts Australia



Pat has a full range of coaching and dog training services at Operant Canine



If you wish to learn a little more stories where we may have been caught out, go here



You can support our show and get extra content right here on our Patreon page. Everything goes into keeping the show running and we love all the wonderful people who are part of that community. If you’re not sure how, just ask us.



You can get our full range of our Merch at our Teespring store here



You can help us by spreading the word amongst the canine community or even suggesting a special guest to interview.



If you need to find out how to listen to our podcast, go here



We have a YOUTUBE channel that you can subscribe to now



If you enjoyed the podcast, please review us on Itunes, spotify and any other podcast directory



Details on joining the IACP can be found here. If you’re not in it you should be! Truth!



Check out Dogs Playing for Life! A rescue process changing dogs lives across the USA



For more details on how to help our friends at Peggy’s Promise, you can find all the details on how to do that on their website. They are our rescue charity of choice.



Support our supporters



Narelle Cooke’s raw feeding guide for dogs here. Narelle has her own podcast on all podcast directories called

title: Episode 222: Setting a dangerous precedent
summary:
Setting a dangerous precedent is focussing on how a state Government decided it would announce the banning of certain training tools.



The concern here once again, is the complete lack of industry consultation along the way with industry experts or any of the thousands of people who use these tools with enormous benefits.



We are joined by Kirsty Reid as she and Brittany Young with assistance from Marcia Davies, have created a on-line petition to demand better representation and consideration from Government decision makers.



What is a precedent you may ask? An earlier event or action that is regarded as an example or guide to be considered in subsequent similar circumstances.



So you may not entirely support some of the training tools that are being considered on the banning list but again the precedence from this action will leech into other areas that will have an effect on something you do want or need.



You can email the ladies direct on dogtrainingqld@gmail.com to receive all the information you require on how to help support this cause.



Further details



looking for great dog trainers and supporters of the canine paradigm? Below is a vast array of people and business’s who stand by us, donate to our running costs and do great things for the canine community.



Glenn runs and has almost everything canine related at, Canine Evolution or Pet Resorts Australia



Pat has a full range of coaching and dog training services at Operant Canine



If you wish to learn a little more stories where we may have been caught out, go here



You can support our show and get extra content right here on our Patreon page. Everything goes into keeping the show running and we love all the wonderful people who are part of that community. If you’re not sure how, just ask us.



You can get our full range of our Merch at our Teespring store here



You can help us by spreading the word amongst the canine community or even suggesting a special guest to interview.



If you need to find out how to listen to our podcast, go here



We have a YOUTUBE channel that you can subscribe to now



If you enjoyed the podcast, please review us on Itunes, spotify and any other podcast directory



Details on joining the IACP can be found here. If you’re not in it you should be! Truth!



Check out Dogs Playing for Life! A rescue process changing dogs lives across the USA



For more details on how to help our friends at Peggy’s Promise, you can find all the details on how to do that on thei...

title: Episode 221: Is your opinion interesting?
summary:
Is your opinion interesting? Or do you just chime in to be a part of the conversation?  It has been said that, 'opinions are like ass holes because everyone has one'.



It's also been stated, 'you're entitled to your opinion'. Regardless of how we feel about them, opinions will always be a part of our social structure.



The on-line dictionary references an opinion as, "a view or judgement formed about something, not necessarily based on fact or knowledge".



For many of us, it's the fact or knowledge section that creates the struggle in any conversation when both are absent.



We also spent this session discussing listener questions again.



Further details



looking for great dog trainers and supporters of the canine paradigm? Below is a vast array of people and business’s who stand by us, donate to our running costs and do great things for the canine community.



Glenn runs and has almost everything canine related at, Canine Evolution or Pet Resorts Australia



Pat has a full range of coaching and dog training services at Operant Canine



If you wish to learn a little more stories where we may have been caught out, go here



You can support our show and get extra content right here on our Patreon page. Everything goes into keeping the show running and we love all the wonderful people who are part of that community. If you’re not sure how, just ask us.



You can get our full range of our Merch at our Teespring store here



You can help us by spreading the word amongst the canine community or even suggesting a special guest to interview.



If you need to find out how to listen to our podcast, go here



We have a YOUTUBE channel that you can subscribe to now



If you enjoyed the podcast, please review us on Itunes, spotify and any other podcast directory



Details on joining the IACP can be found here. If you’re not in it you should be! Truth!



Check out Dogs Playing for Life! A rescue process changing dogs lives across the USA



For more details on how to help our friends at Peggy’s Promise, you can find all the details on how to do that on their website. They are our rescue charity of choice.



Support our supporters



Narelle Cooke’s raw feeding guide for dogs here.

title: Episode 220: The minimum standard of a dog trainer
summary:
The minimum standard of a dog trainer is a talking point we had with our friend, Jo Rosie Heffenden.  The topic around being a trainer and standards gets brought up a lot in conversations.



The reason being is that there are so many trainers who do not have any certifications and in some cases, no real training at all.



So how can you be a  dog trainer with no qualifications with such a huge responsibility?  The answer is easy.  Nobody seems to care much.



Further details



looking for great dog trainers and supporters of the canine paradigm? Below is a vast array of people and business’s who stand by us, donate to our running costs and do great things for the canine community.



Glenn runs and has almost everything canine related at, Canine Evolution or Pet Resorts Australia



Pat has a full range of coaching and dog training services at Operant Canine



If you wish to learn a little more stories where we may have been caught out, go here



You can support our show and get extra content right here on our Patreon page. Everything goes into keeping the show running and we love all the wonderful people who are part of that community. If you’re not sure how, just ask us.



You can get our full range of our Merch at our Teespring store here



You can help us by spreading the word amongst the canine community or even suggesting a special guest to interview.



If you need to find out how to listen to our podcast, go here



We have a YOUTUBE channel that you can subscribe to now



If you enjoyed the podcast, please review us on Itunes, spotify and any other podcast directory



Details on joining the IACP can be found here. If you’re not in it you should be! Truth!



Check out Dogs Playing for Life! A rescue process changing dogs lives across the USA



For more details on how to help our friends at Peggy’s Promise, you can find all the details on how to do that on their website. They are our rescue charity of choice.



Support our supporters



Narelle Cooke’s raw feeding guide for dogs here. Narelle has her own podcast on all podcast directories called Natural Health for people and pets. Check it out.
